If an expectedHash is used in this call, the hash of the downloaded file is compared to the expected hash received, triggering an InvalidDataException if they differ. The downloaded content is saved in the disk, in the specified directory (filePath).

member.name: M:GenericAutoUpdater.Downloaders.HttpClientDownloader.DownloadData(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method tries to download a specific file (address) a pre-defined number of times (DownloaderConfigs.MAX_DOWNLOAD_RETRIES_PER_FILE). It is also responsible for putting the BackgroundWorker Thread to sleep a pre-defined amount of time (DownloaderConfigs.INTERVAL_MS_BETWEEN_DOWNLOAD_RETRIES) between each download retry. It uses the Download method for that purpose, calling it with the received arguments. If no file path was received in argument (i.e., string.Empty), it waits for the returned Download's Task to finish before returning the downloaded content as an in-memory byte[]. If there is a file path specified (i.e., different from string.Empty), this method returns null after the Download is finished.

member.name: M:GenericAutoUpdater.Downloaders.HttpClientDownloader.Download(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method tries to download a specific file from a specific url (address). If no file path was received (i.e., file parameter is null), this method returns an in-memory byte[] with the downloaded file. If there is a file path in the parameter path, the download is performed directly into a file with the same name and relative path as the one in the address and this method returns null. If it completes the download and an expectedHash was received (i.e., the respective parameter isn't null), it checks if the hash of the downloaded file equals the expected hash of that same file (expectedHash), throwing an InvalidDataException if it doesn't. This method also logs the download progress to the respective progress bar through the BackgroundWorker (bw), whenever it assumes it is necessary.

member.name: M:GenericAutoUpdater.Downloaders.HttpClientDownloader.RecalculateSpeedAverage(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Recalculates the average speed of the current download based on the new speed sample just measured. It weights the new speed sample using a previously defined ratio (DownloaderConfigs.SAMPLE_SPEED_WEIGHT).

member.name: M:GenericAutoUpdater.Downloaders.HttpClientDownloader.HandleStatusCode(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Handles the received status code of the HTTP request performed. This method is only called when the status code isn't a Success Status code. When the status code is a Server Error, the download flow is continued so that a retry is done, if the limit of retries hasn't yet been reached. When the status code isn't a Server Error, there is no point in retrying the Download, thus a HttpRequestException is trown - denied of a retry.
